thread.title: Shane Heal joins NBA legends in new league
thread.title_full: Shane Heal joins NBA legends in new league

title: Shane Heal joins NBA legends in new league
text:
Shane Heal joins NBA legends in new BIG3 3-on-3 league  54am @olgunuluc Source: FOX SPORTS AUSTRALIAN basketball great, Shane Heal, is among the latest signings to the BIG3 Draft player pool, putting him just a step away from being selected to play in the new 3-on-3 league. 
Heal, 46, last played professional basketball for the Gold Coast Blaze in the NBL, but will join the likes of Keith Bogans, Rasha McCants, Earl Boykins, Smush Parker, and Jamario Moon as players eligible for the upcoming BIG3 Draft. 
The league, which is a 3-on-3 basketball concept, was created by rapper and actor, Ice Cube, and has already signed on several NBA legends to be players and/or coaches, including Allen Iverson, Chauncey Billups, Jason Williams, Charles Oakley, Clyde Drexler, and Rick Barry. 
The commissioner of the BIG3 is retired NBA role player, Roger Mason Jr., who also serves as the deputy executive director of the NBA players Association. NBL commentator, Shane Heal. Source: Getty Images 
Heal isn’t officially on one of the eight rosters — each featuring five players — but he’ll have the opportunity to show his worth in a combine held in April. Player captains, co-captains, coaches, and executives will watch the draft players compete in scrimmages, drills, and strength and conditioning workouts, before the league holds its draft. 
Heal, a four-time Olympian and NBL Champion, is currently a commentator for Fox Sports Australia’s coverage of the NBL. 
The inaugural season of this new league is set to tip off on June 25, 2017 (AEDT), in the United States.
